create.title: Create a new organization
create.content:
Creates a new organization having a server-side autogenerated org_id and the given optional list of key-value-pairs.

  • return Hash The created entity

The usage of the key ‘id’ is not valid for this request and will lead to http error 400 Bad Request. For concurrency reasons, this request demands the usage of the “If-Match”-header matching the last known state of the orgs collection represented as an ETag. This state (the ETag) can be requested by e.g. a GET or a HEAD request.

Example:

curl -XCREATE http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs

{ "name": "belectric_its", "properties": { "type": "Grid" }, "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000003" }

get.title: Get"s a list of organizations
get.content:
Returns a (filtered) list of organizations.

  • param skip Integer Number of elements to skeep before start the operation
  • param take Integer Number of elements to be shown as a result
  • return Array List of organizations

Example:

http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs?skip=3&take=10

[ { "name": "belectric_its", "properties": { "type": "Grid" }, "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000003" } ]

options.title: Get"s the list of valid HTTP verbs
options.content:
Return a list of valid HTTP methods/verbs for the given resource.

Example:

curl -X OPTIONS http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs

head.title: Return the resource available headers
head.content:
Return only the headers (not including the body) of the given resource.

  • return String Returns only the set of headers related with this resource

Example:

curl -XHEAD http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs

HTTP/1.1 200 OK ETag: 1234 Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 182

monitor.title: Monitor the resouce throw SSE
monitor.content:
Creates and event stream that inform the users registered to it throw Server Send Events about the resource status

  • return Void

This resource must be used to register and get Server Send Events about every update, or anything relevant, happening in this resource.

Example:

curl -XMONITOR http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs

/orgs/:org.title: An API for accessing a single organization

get.title: Get"s the given organization stored data
get.content:
Gets a given organization

  • param org_id String The organization name
  • return Hash The organization data

Example:

curl -XGET http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its

{ "name": "belectric_its", "properties": { "type": "Grid" }, "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000003" }

head.title: Return the server headers, without the body
head.content:
Return only the headers (not including the body) of the given resource.

  • param org_id String The organization name
  • return String Returns only the set of headers related with this resource

Example:

curl -XHEAD http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its

HTTP/1.1 200 OK ETag: 1234 Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 182

options.title: Get"s the list of valid HTTP verbs
options.content:
Return a list of valid HTTP methods/verbs for the given resource.

Example:

curl -X OPTIONS http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its

put.title: Updates or add data to a previously created organization
put.content:
Update the set of properties within a given organization

  • param org_id String The organization name
  • return Hash The new organization data

The body must contain a json hash with the properties you wan to be updated or appended to the organization, keep in mind the name must match.

Example:

curl -XPUT http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its

{ "name": "belectric_its", "properties": { "type": "Grid" }, "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000003" }

monitor.title: Monitor the resouce throw SSE
monitor.content:
Creates and event stream that inform the users registered to it throw Server Send Events about the resource status

  • return Void

This resource must be used to register and get Server Send Events about every update, or anything relevant, happening in this resource.

Example:

curl -XMONITOR http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs

delete.title: Deletes a given organization
delete.content:
Delete all resources matching a given function within the HTTP body. (optional)

  • body String The function used to filter the elements to be deleted.
  • return Hash The deleted element

Example:

curl -X DELETE http://example.com/orgs/belectric_its

/orgs/:org/maps.title: Set of resources to handle maps within organizations

get.title: Gets the list of maps in an organization
get.content:
Returns a (filtered) list of maps.

  • param org String The organization name
  • param skip Integer Number of elements to skeep before start the operation
  • param take Integer Number of elements to be shown as a result
  • return Array List of maps

Example:

http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps?skip=3&take=10

[ { "name": "germany", "properties": { "type": "SolarPower" }, "organization": "belectric_its", "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000004" } ]

create.title: Adds a new map
create.content:
Add a new resource to a collection of resources

  • return Hash The created entity

The usage of the key ‘id’ is not valid for this request and will lead to http error 400 Bad Request. For concurrency reasons, this request demands the usage of the “If-Match”-header matching the last known state of the orgs collection represented as an ETag. This state (the ETag) can be requested by e.g. a GET or a HEAD request.

Example:

curl -XCREATE http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps

{ "name": "germany", "properties": { "type": "SolarPower" }, "organization": "belectric_its", "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000004" }

head.title: Return the server headers, without the body
head.content:
Return only the headers (not including the body) of the given resource.

  • param org_id String The organization name
  • return String Returns only the set of headers related with this resource

Example:

curl -XHEAD http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps

HTTP/1.1 200 OK ETag: 1234 Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 182

options.title: Get"s the list of valid HTTP verbs
options.content:
Return a list of valid HTTP methods/verbs for the given resource.

Example:

curl -X OPTIONS http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps

monitor.title: Monitor the resouce throw SSE
monitor.content:
Creates and event stream that inform the users registered to it throw Server Send Events about the resource status

  • return Void

This resource must be used to register and get Server Send Events about every update, or anything relevant, happening in this resource.

Example:

curl -XMONITOR http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps

/orgs/:org/maps/:map.title: How to handle a given map

get.title: Gets the list of maps in an organization
get.content:
Return a single map data

  • param org String The organization name
  • param map String The map we want the data from
  • return Hash The map data

Example:

curl -X GET http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps/germany

{ "name": "germany", "properties": { "type": "SolarPower" }, "organization": "belectric_its", "id": "51c95ca4d1da60255e000004" }

head.title: Return the server headers, without the body
head.content:
Return only the headers (not including the body) of the given resource.

  • param org String The organization name

  • param map String A map name

  • return String Returns only the set of headers related with this resource

Example:

curl -XHEAD http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps/germany

HTTP/1.1 200 OK ETag: 1234 Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 182

options.title: Get"s the list of valid HTTP verbs
options.content:
Return a list of valid HTTP methods/verbs for the given resource.

Example:

curl -X OPTIONS http://api.linkedenergy.eu:1884/orgs/belectric_its/maps/germany
